page.title: 03FARMING,SOUTH FEN & TWENTY
page.content: The{main crops grown}in the South Fen area of Twenty and Tongue End are {winter wheat, sugar beet and potatoes. Also to be seen growing on the flat, rich, black fenland soil is{celery.} Several farmers are re-planting {trees for conservation}purposes to replace the many elms that were once so common before they fell to Dutch elm disease. Until recently there were between two and three hundred old fen willows but even these have gradually died away. Farmers have pulled also pulled up trees and {filled in dykes}to make{fields larger. Indeed,few farm yards have many trees. Much of the regular{weeding and } {hoeing}is undertaken{(by hand)}by the local people who may be seen working in the fields on most days.
